title: Security Advisory for .NET packages hosted at the NuGet Gallery
description: Security Advisory for .NET packages hosted at the NuGet Gallery on GitHub

items.content_html:
ChakraCore and Windows 10 1709 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886, CVE-2017-11889, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894, CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11909, CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11911, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913, CVE-2017-11914, CVE-2017-11916, CVE-2017-11918, and CVE-2017-11930.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11908
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11908
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/pull/4411
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/commit/39eecff7daecce96088f7ed737f145ee4774faa6
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124122457/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/102052
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210829201729/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039990
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-923j-972p-hchf
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore RCE Vulnerability

items.content_html:
ChakraCore and Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894, CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11908, CVE-2017-11909, CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11911, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913, CVE-2017-11914, CVE-2017-11916, CVE-2017-11918, and CVE-2017-11930.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11889
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11889

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210829201729/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039990
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xw5f-g937-wgm2

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Umbraco CMS before 7.7.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the "page name" (aka nodename) parameter during the creation of a new page, related to Umbraco.Web.UI/umbraco/dialogs/Publish.aspx.cs and Umbraco.Web/umbraco.presentation/umbraco/dialogs/notifications.aspx.cs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15279
  • https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/commit/fe2b86b681455ac975b294652064b2718d4e2ba2
  • http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-10497
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xj94-rgf9-cq37
items.title: [UmbracoCMS.Core] Umbraco CMS vulnerable to stored XSS

items.content_html:
XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability in Umbraco CMS before 7.7.3 allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading files on the server or sending TCP requests to intranet hosts (aka SSRF), related to Umbraco.Web/umbraco.presentation/umbraco/dialogs/importDocumenttype.aspx.cs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15280
  • https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/commit/5dde2efe0d2b3a47d17439e03acabb7ea2befb64
  • http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-10506
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h2vq-7gf2-qw9v
items.title: [UmbracoCms.Core] Umbraco CMS XXE Vulnerability

ChakraCore and Windows 10 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886, CVE-2017-11889, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894, CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11908, CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11911, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913, CVE-2017-11914, CVE-2017-11916, CVE-2017-11918, and CVE-2017-11930.

items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore RCE Vulnerability

items.content_html:
ChakraCore and Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to gain the same user rights as the current user, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886, CVE-2017-11889, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894, CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11908, CVE-2017-11909, CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11911, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913, CVE-2017-11916, CVE-2017-11918, and CVE-2017-11930.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11914
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11914
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43713/
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/pull/4411

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210829201729/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039990
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8r5c-8v97-g7vh
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore Privilege Escalation

This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11886, CVE-2017-11889, CVE-2017-11890, CVE-2017-11893, CVE-2017-11894, CVE-2017-11895, CVE-2017-11901, CVE-2017-11903, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11905, CVE-2017-11907, CVE-2017-11908, CVE-2017-11909, CVE-2017-11910, CVE-2017-11912, CVE-2017-11913, CVE-2017-11914, CVE-2017-11916, CVE-2017-11918, and CVE-2017-11930.

items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore RCE Vulnerability

items.content_html:
ChakraCore allows an attacker to gain the same user rights as the current user, due to the way that the ChakraCore scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability".

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11767
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-11767
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/pull/3727
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/pull/3727/commits/b3e3959d14814f42ee2197c504c322bcbe12347d
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124103810/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100838
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211127230635/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1039369
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c79v-2rjq-965m
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore Privilege Escalation

items.content_html:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the browser scripting engine improperly handle object types, aka "Microsoft Scripting Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects ChakraCore, Internet Explorer 11, Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer 10.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8315
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2018-8315
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/pull/5688
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/commit/e03b3e30160ac5846b246931634962ce6bd1db83
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124203128/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105251
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206083609/https://securitytracker.com/id/1041623
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-93c7-2942-3h47
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore information disclosure vulnerability

items.content_html:
DNN (formerly DotNetNuke) 9.1.1 allows cross-site scripting (XSS) via XML.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14486
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/151304/DNN-9.1-XML-Related-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6w9-8cxc-jff7
items.title: [DotNetNuke.Core] DNN XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Umbraco CMS 7.12.3 allows authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script via the Header Name of a content (Blog, Content Page, etc.). The vulnerability is exploited when updating or removing public access of a content.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-17256
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wrrj-r2j4-969w
items.title: [umbraco] Umbraco CMS vulnerable to stored XSS

items.content_html:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists when Chakra improperly discloses the contents of its memory, which could provide an attacker with information to further compromise the user's computer or data, aka "Chakra Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability." This affects ChakraCore, Internet Explorer 11, Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer 10. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0943, CVE-2018-8130, CVE-2018-8133, CVE-2018-8177.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8145
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2018-8145
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45011/
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124164314/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103986
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211204185256/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040844
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xphq-3x6q-q2qq
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore information disclosure vulnerability

items.content_html:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the scripting engine does not properly handle objects in memory in Microsoft browsers, aka "Scripting Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This affects ChakraCore, Internet Explorer 11, Microsoft Edge.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8452
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2018-8452
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/commit/3f3544801cc01e9f54cab84b20602a3b5e29c3ef
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124203129/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105252
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20221128100304/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1041623
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w3qr-8v4r-592m
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore information disclosure vulnerability

items.content_html:
A security feature bypass vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Chakra scripting engine that allows Control Flow Guard (CFG) to be bypassed, aka "Scripting Engine Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability." This affects Microsoft Edge, ChakraCore.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8276
  • https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2018-8276
  • https://github.com/chakra-core/ChakraCore/commit/4196f8097afdcc5fe01ce2966871712fb24003a3
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124183457/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104626
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211202002348/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1041256
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wg47-6cqc-q52j
items.title: [Microsoft.ChakraCore] ChakraCore Security Bypass
